Reviews.Title: “is a must if you are in Rome”
Reviews.Author: reinaldo a
Reviews.Content: elegant ,beauty,wich room are spacious,the breakfast was wonderful,near to this hotel there are many store for your shopping,The staff is very kind and the concierge give to us one precious advise on where dinner Ristorante Mare it was fantastic seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden In Plain Sight”
Reviews.Author: ElJeffeMiami
Reviews.Content: Small entry on busy shopping street should not deter any travellor looking for a quiet, clean, well appointed hotel. Staff very accomodating re every detail. Don't miss this one if you have the Euro's, want this location and prefer to stay away from the large commercial hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Laura525
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that would be centrally located and also small and special. The Daniel's hotel was all of that and more. Our room was spacious and very luxurious. The complimentary breakfast (and cappucino's) was really wonderful. The hotel is situated on a very lovely shopping street that is ideally situated within walking distance to many of the major sites, such as the Colliseium. All of that plus the concierge staff could not have been more friendly or helpful with everything we needed. A great hotel and we will stay there when we return to Rom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Natalia G
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel, very well located near the Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi, good breakfast, confortable accomodations. Must improve the cable tv. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great, we enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: GeoffS99123
Reviews.Content: We had the same experience as many others. Great location, friendly staff. The rooms are to a high standard and a bit more personal then many other hotels. The Roadworks in Via Frattini did not bother us. The only (tiny) problem was the Wifi - very slow and unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “The superior rooms were very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: BJamieson
Reviews.Content: We loved Daniel's Hotel. We stayed there for 6 nights in September and were very comfortable and happy to be there. The room was spotless and we loved the staff. They patiently let me use their laptop every evening and their suggestions for restaurants were good. We loved the location. It is the best in Rome, especially if you like to shop and have restaurants close by. The breakfast was very good, with something for everyone. There was fresh fruit and a large fruit bowl, yogurt, cereal, pastries, breads for toast and all was fresh. The back rooms were very quiet even though there was construction on Via Frattina when we were there. I would happily stay there again when in Rome as in a way it felt like home due to its small size. Thanks for a great service!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: These guys did us a HUGE favour. We got kicked out of another hotel earl on our last day in Rome. The people at Daniel's let us stay for a day only (not over night), at a great price. They gave us breakfast and organised our trip to the airport. The shower was amazing. We couldn't thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Airsealands
Reviews.Content: Staff is helpful, the location is amazing by any standard. Breakfast is ok, not more than that

Reviews.Title: “A central location to love and remember...”
Reviews.Author: DanJames62
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome to the effortless service and deep knowledge for the needs of the Roman tourist, this stunning, centrally located boutique hotel cannot be bettered. The room we booked (it has to be room 502 with a private terrace) was beautifully neat, well equipped and surprisingly quiet for a hotel right in the middle of the city's attractions. The breakfast buffet served on the rooftop terrace, despite no hot dishes, was a more than adequate start to a busy day of sightseeing and the friendly, brilliant waiters kept the supply of delicious double espresso's flowing. Huge thanks then to the wonderful receptionists Danilo and Emanuela for making our stay in the eternal city such an effortless pleasure and wonderful experience. We'll have no hesitation in returning to this jewel in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, okay hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Tussi284
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Cute, nice and clean hotel. Pretty small but my room was quite spacious. The only problem, which was a HUGE problem, was the perfume/scent in my room. It was so overpowering that I literally had a hard time breathing and had to hang out of the window (which faced a boring courtyard..). I even had to hold my nose when visiting the bathroom because of the strong perfume/scent. I got a headache as soon as I had been in the room for a while.. I tried to sleep with the windows open but then I woke up 4 times during the night because I heard absolutely everything! If you would take away that horrible perfume/scent this hotel would be great. The breakfast room was so hot since it was at the top of the hotel.. And the AC didn't seem to be working. But the view was fantastic! Location: The location couldn't be more perfect. Right in the middle of everything. I couldn't pick a better location for a visit to Rome. I've been many times but this was the best location, if you like to be in the middle of everything, of course. Staff: The staff was quite helpful and nice. Nothing more and nothing less. Conclusion: If the hotel did these minor changes to the place I would love to come back! The location is perfect but the perfume was the worst thing I've EVER experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BellNori
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights. The hotel was located in the middle of the shopping street but it was quiet in the night. Our room was spacious but had no windows that we had no idea which part of the building we were staying.... The reception staff was helpful. Breakfast served on the top floor was decent. Overall the hotel was very nice I felt like staying in comfortable apartment in rome.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Indry_29
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel is extremely helpful, both Flori n Clara (recepsionist) was very nice and explain every thing I ask. Early in the morning they help me to find color printer to print my Colloseum ticket. The Best is they give me room with private teras because I'm asking for a smoning room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice butique hotel, expensive”
Reviews.Author: yotamhc
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling the whole family - parents and three grown up children. The hotel is nice with great service. Very clean and comfort rooms. The staff is very friendly, with fluent English, and the location is great (though at night everything gets closed in the area). Also, the breakfast on the rooftop is rich, and the service at the dining room is also great. The only problem with the hotel is the price, like other hotels in this level in Rome. That's why I can't promise we'll be back again. Another, smaller problem, is the WiFi connection. It was slow and required a password each time, which was annoying...

Reviews.Title: “Rapture in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sultan45
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I stayed in Daniel's Hotel for a long weekend break recently. The first thing that struck me as I entered was the cleanliness and attention to detail of the furnishings and decor. The ambience was of refined elegance. It is a small boutique hotel with only an entrance corridor, reception and small coffee dock/ bar/sitting room to the rear on the ground floor. There are two small lifts and a breakfast room on the sixth floor with panoramic views of the city. We stayed in a junior suite on the first floor. The room was spacious, the bed very large, plasma screen,mini bar,fresh fruit and flowers each day.The bathroom was also large with a jacuzzi bath/shower, bvulgari bath products and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was ample with a good choice. Receptionists couldn't have been nicer between sending a member of staff for batteries for us, to providing us with coffee as we waited for our transfer to the airport. This hotel is in the centre of things, a real find. We'll go back again if given the opportunity. Thanks to all at Daniel's for making our trip to Rome absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Helen2532
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband at the Daniel's hotel for a long weekend vacation, The reason we chose this hotel is the location, whick is perfect for sightseeing and shopping ! We made the reservation through booking.com and got a decent rate, considering the season and the quality and level of service of the hotel. This is a small and intimate hotel ideal for couple and I would definately stay there again due to its convinient location, if I could get a good deal !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable & clean”
Reviews.Author: Susedunne_2
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. In a great spot. Was a little noisy when windows were open.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay if you like to shop till you drop!”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelGirl07869
Reviews.Content: I am just about to check out tomorrow morning from here and I must say it's with a sad heart. I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I selected this hotel for my short 2.5 trip to Rome after a 1.5 week of business travel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. My main objective, SHOPPING! This hotel is excellently positioned for walking and shopping. You have all the higher end shops and the great bargin shops between the Fountain of Trevi and the Piazza di Popolo. The hotel is nicely situated right in the middle and 3 mins walk to the Spanish steps. The hotel is small but, the rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. Everything is clean and the location safe. The breakfast is served in the very scenic rooftop terrace. The morning sun takes your breath awayt. The only negative comments are for the bed...hard as a rock. Also, the constant banging...seems they were some repairs going on and the noise made me want to take a hostage. I saved the use of my in room jacuzzi to my last day and well that was a mistake. It wasn't a relaxing end to a long 2 days of shopping. Except for that last bit of noise, there is nothing that would keep me from staying here the next time I came to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dmth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights here. The place is, admittedly, on the expensive side. But we were on a long planned anniversary trip and splurged. Our room was excellent, very large, with a sitting area and a large bathroom. It was directly over the street and we enjoyed the people watching, but it was very quiet with the windows closed. The rooftop breakfast room offered a lavish spread. The staff made every effort to ensure a pleasant stay in Rome. The location could not have been more convenient for walking or to the Metro stop at the Spanish Steps. A big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: catraveler408
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel!!! The staff and hotel facitilites were wonderful and beyond our expectations. The rooms were larger than expected including the Junior suite, even by US standards. We travel often on business so accustom to nice hotels and this was equal to our US business/leisure travels. The Junior suite had a large bath and seating area providing more than enough room, very clean with comfortable bed/pillows. The breakfast included was served on the roof terrace and offered a great variety of pastries, juices, fruits, quiches, meats and cheese, including very good coffee. The location was excellent, surrounded by many restaurants, cafes and shops. Our room opened to the street below which only allows pedestrians or taxi's with permission, so other than chatter, you are not bothered by car noise. We were two blocks from the Spanish steps and easy walking distance to many other top sites. The entire staff helped in so many ways I'm not sure where to begin. We arrived with wet luggage/clothes due to a bad storm in Chicago where our luggage must have sat on the runway with the plane and they immediately helped with the drying process. Arriving at 9:00am Rome time, they allowed us to rest and unpack the wet clothing in a smaller room than our Junior suite which was still sizeable and decorated nicely. Every restaurant suggestion was excellent, directions even better for sites, walking, etc. We encountered a car rental problem when leaving for Positano, but they were able to correct and locate a new car which even took them extra time speaking Italian, so doubt we would have been as successful without their help. I hope to return to Rome and when we do, we will stay at this hotel even longer. It was the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping & Touring Location”
Reviews.Author: CMC777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for the tourist traveller who wishes to spend most of the day and night touring, shopping and experiencing the excellent cuisine. The hotel facilities are limited so don't expect anything like that of a bigger hotel.... The bar is a small space behind reception and the roof top restaurant is an enclosed space and baking hot in the morning (for breakfast only). Breakfast is adequate for a quick start to the day but the coffee is poor... On a very positive note though: Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. It is a little tired but I can't really fault it because the location is outstanding.. And when in Rome there is so much to do outside.. Why would you want more that to sleep in the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small hotel, big room”
Reviews.Author: LIMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a somewhat rainy week in mid-September. We stayed in one of the suites on the second floor. The room was very large. It had a king sized bed, a love seat and chair in a sitting area, a writing desk, a decent sized armoire, a small flat screen tv, small fridge and coat rack/luggage storage area. The room was clean and comfortably appointed. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub/shower and was also large. The staff were very helpful in helping with restaurants, taxis etc. They also recommended a great local restaurant a couple of blocks away. Ristorante Mario at Via della Vite, 55 was excellent, and felt more local than touristy. The breakfast is nice, and they are happy to serve it in your room if you don't want to make the elevator trip up to the roof.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Steveeddc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine in almost all respects. The rooms are very large by the standards in Rome and very clean. The breakfast was fair at best. I am not a fan of the neighorhood. It is similar to most tourist filled high-end shopping districts that you will find in most large cities -- nothing very special to me about it. There are so many neighborhoods in Rome that are much more charming and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Best: location, service and breakfast on the roof”
Reviews.Author: IL42
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for hotel in excellent location, you find your spot. DH is a small hotel in excellent location, near the Spanish steps in a quiet street with nice shopping at the hotel doorstep. Great service by sensitive and accommodating staff Rooms are clean, quiet and not smelly Breakfast: superb on the roof location with the sounds of the seagulls and most important good and tasty food selection toped by fresh made espresso and cappuccinos. However if your looking for an hotel in the center of Rome with parking, big lobby, gym, spa etc’ you will need to keep on looking (and probably pay much more).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Violetviolet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Daniel's in Spetember 2008. This small hotel is wonderfully located in the middle of everything. All - or almost all -those spectacular attractions of Rome are within a walking distance, and great shopping opportunities as well. Hotel is beatyfully decorated, and the staff is very nice. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace - +++! However there were some minor things I want to bring out here. Several reviews here mention the hotel is quiet. That may be the case with some of the rooms, but certainly not ours. Be aware of the first floor! Another detail was the jacuzzi - it did not work properly. OK I have to admit I did not report this to the staff - they might have been able to fix it. However this was not so important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: goaliedad30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife & two teenagers following our recent cruise. Awesome experience! Very convenient location, and with the help of a private tour guide, we managed to see all the major sights in Rome in just one day. Service was impeccable, including setting up a personalized "early" breakfast for us because we had to leave early to get to the airport. Charming, comfortable rooms, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious ...”
Reviews.Author: veroamore
Reviews.Content: daniel's hotel is located in the heart of the tourist section of rome yet it is an oasis of calm. we had a lovely, spacious room and enjoyed breakfasts on the rooftop terrace. the location is very convenient if you want to see most of the touristy things (right near the spanish steps). cars cannot drive on the street - pedestrian traffic only so be prepared to lug your suitcases the final distance! the woman at the front desk recommended a fabulous restaurant called before to us - totally untouristy and we had a wonderful meal and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Tmcrose
Reviews.Content: My parents, husband and I spent 3 lovely nights at Daniel's Hotel the beginning of November. It is charming and the location was fantastic around the corner from the Spanish Steps. I believe there are only 2 rooms per floor and we had the 2 on the 5th floor. Ours had a private balcony which is perfect for sitting out and sipping some wine and my parents had a view of the charming street. The rooms and baths are immaculate and beautifully decorated. Fresh fruit was left each day. The breakfast room on the 6th (top) floor was charming with views of the local rooftops and gardens! The food was wonderful and was a great start to our busy days. The girls that work there were very sweet and helpful. They were happy to serve us wine and drinks in the little bar every evening! My only complaint is that the gentleman that worked there evenings was a bit diffucult when it came to making restaurant reservations, but overall we felt like we had found a hidden gem of a hotel in Rome! Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: archriste
Reviews.Content: "We booked our stay at Hotel Daniel based mostly on reviews on Trip Advisor. The Hotel was nice with an exceptional location if you want to shop and see some of the major sites...Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival so I cannot comment on room size. Our Suite was large by European standards. My biggest complaint was the lack of hot water around 7:00 p.m. just when you need a hot shower! The water was tepid at best! The staff was O.K. I was a bit disappointed based on some of the former reviews I had read on trip advisor. One particular staff member was wonderful, but the rest were very mediocre. We also felt they recommended "touristy" resturaunts vs. authentic cuisine. Our best meal, which we found on foot, was in Travestere. Hotel Daniel was fine overall, but upon returning, I might spend a bit more money for some better service and more ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: torn80
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the daniel hotel after going through at least a hundred hotels on trip adviser. oh my goodness, what a wonderful place. we got there and were told we had been upgraded to a junior suite. the room was gorgeous, leather sofa, high end bed linens, jacuzzi, wonderful shower. the room was large by european standards and the hotel was situated on a street only accessible to taxis and pedestrians so the noise factor was limited. breakfast was extremely pleasant, in the roof garden, clean and cheery. the capuccino was wonderful, as were the croissants filled with nutella. the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. they helped us with reservations for dinner each night and with maps for all the locations during the day. francesca and emanuela were wonderful. the only downfall was no high speed internet. but, if needed, one could use the computer at the lobby desk (one gentleman actually downloaded all his mail so he could read it on the plane). this hotel was truly excellent, more like a private home than a hotel. thank you for a wonderful stay in rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: VivMidlands
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in April 2007 as a break away for just me and my husband. Having done many city breaks but having never travelled to Rome before we booked this hotel"blindly" having no recommendations from friends etc. The place is superbly located-a stones throw away from the Spanish steps, a short walk to Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. It is set on a street with super shops and bars and at the end of the road you can easily get a cab or a bus if you don't want to walk to your destination. The room that we had was very plush although not enormous. The bed was large and extremely comfortable and the furniture was of the very best quality. The staff were extremeley polite and helpful. We only had breakfast in the hotel on the delightful roof terrace restaurant which overlooks the roof tops of old Rome-a perfect start to the day, although the breakfast was basic.

Reviews.Title: “NOT boutique NOT four stars BARELY a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shahira
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews on TA and other websites and I was very disappointed! I love the details and quality of service of boutique hotels and hoped this one with its great location would be one to add to my list but sadly NO. First the positives location is magnificent, especially since my mother and I were staying for only three nights and going for shopping the location was perfect, we could drop some of the bags, start shopping the moment we stepped outside the hotel, it is also surrounded by several great cafes and rests. for lunch and dinner litterally steps away. Another positive was the size of the room, on check in we were informed that we were upgraded to a triple room, which was a pleasant surprise, the room is a spacious double room but in no way could accomodate three people, the wardrobe was very small though, it was clean and the windows are soundproof, no view at all one of the windows opened to plumbing, and the other opened to windows of other rooms where we could see and hear the other guests. The bathroom was the same spacious and clean. There is practically nothing else good about this hotel, the entrance is tiny that you can barely see it if you are a few buildings away which scared us a bit, then you go into a very narrow long corridor to the reception, two people cannot pass side by side in this corridor, one day as i was entering the housekeeping lady was standing with her things and we spent a few minutes trying to pass by eachother without dropping everything we were holding or squashing eachother. The elevator did some weird noises as were going up and it is in bad need for renovation. The conceirge is not very informative or knowledgable about rests. or reccomendations, I asked her about a couple of restaurants which were supposedly famous she didnt know them, when I asked her for reccomendation for a typical italian restaurant she said she had to think about it and call me back and when she did she reccomended a rest that was close but average at best. We had also requested the pick up service from the airport which turned out to be more expensive than a taxi, around 15-20 more euros, he was standing with a barely legible sign with our name we spent ten minutes looking for him, he drove while talking on the phone and alot of people were honking their horns at him for his driving AND he ran an errand while we were with him taking us on a detour to be able to do that!! The breakfast they informed us we could have in the breakfast room or in our room we opted for our room, but that was a horrific experience, the coffee tasted cold and ugly (the first and last ugly weird tasting coffee I had in Italy), the croissant was not fresh, the honey was frozen, and the five jams they got us were all in one flavor! when I complained to the receptionist, I think she was surprised or didnt understand but the breakfast the next day was worse with the croissant worse then the first day and the same weird coffee I didnt have any breakfast and we ate it outside! Other than that there was basically no extra service that is usually associated with boutique hotels, or four star hotels, like bathrobes, or slippers, or nice shampoos or creams. Nothing extra that I expected. My mother described it like renting a tiny flat rather than a hotel room which I think fits. For me this is overpriced for what it serves and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Sbavay
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel looking reviews on tripadvisor, and choose it because of the good results, no regrets : staff very sympathic and helpful, situation very good, breakfast very varied. We arrived in the morning about 10 o'clock, our room wasn't ready, so I proposed to have a walk and come later, but the woman at the reception proposed us to go up and have breakfast : it was very welcome as we woke up early and didn't have time to take it before ! when breakfast was finished we had our room (they phoned in the breakfast room to say it to us). the last day as the room seemed not to be taken before the next day, they proposed us to stay later, till 5 pm as we have small chlidren (20 month and 3 years) so they could slept the afternoon. They didn't charged us more for the first breakfast nor the last afternoon. I highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountaintravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 25th anniversary trip through Southern Italy and Sicily and this was our first stop. We stayed 3 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. I'm a fanatic about researching hotels and in Rome there are many excellent choices, but this hotel turned out to be a terrific for us, mainly because of its small size (I am a fan of boutique hotels), central location, the friendly staff, and qualilty accommodations. We were upgraded to a junior suite and although I initially was concerned that it faced the street from the second level (first floor in Europe), the street is mainly a pedestrian one (except taxis are allowed to deliver you and your luggage to the hotel's front door) so there was little noise and the heavy draperies could be closed to block out light. The room and the bath were the largest we've ever had in all of our European travels and beautifully decorated in an Italian baroque style. Although that style doesn't reflect our personal design taste, it seemed very appropriate for our time in Rome. The ceilings were exceptionally high and the room and bathroom were immaculate and the king sized bed incredibly comfortable. We ate breakfast on the top floor. While not a roof terrace because it is enclosed, the massive windows make it feel like you are outside, looking over the rooftops. The food was plentiful and varied and typical of an Italian breakfast with mainly cold items, which suited us fine. We enjoy walking and were able to walk to most sites and restaurants. In fact, on the first morning, we walked to the Vatican to meet our tour guide from Angel Tours (only 4 of us in the group which was wonderful considering how crowded it was). We also walked to most other places we visited, including the Trastavere area (now that's a trek!) and back from the Colosseum. The hotel is close to the Spanish Steps and the main upscale shopping area. While we didn't do any serious shopping we enjoyed walking in the area and looking into the elegant and interesting window displays. We had excellent meals in different Rome neighborhoods, each of which we walked to at least one way. My only complaint would be a lack of internet service. While there was dial up internet if you brought your laptop, we had to go quite a distance to find an internet cafe to use to check our email. In all the other boutique properties at which we stayed, the hotel provided a computer on site for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjtwo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nightat at the Hotel Daniel. Our room overlooked the street and was very nice. Bathroom was very nice. Service was excellent. The location was perfect, right in the middle of the great shopping area around Spanish Steps. We loved it and would go back again. The breakfast on their rooftop was great and so was the view! Desk recommended Mario's for dinner - one street over - excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia-YorkPA
Reviews.Content: Daniel's Hotels exceeded all of our expectations. My husband and I travelled to Rome for a six days to celebrate my 50th birthday. The staff at Daniel's Hotel was professional and kind at all times. When I didn't understand how to use the room's telephone to make a collect call, a staff person immediately came to our room to show me. We spoke no Italian, but it really didn't matter, the staff spoke English and were always gracious. Our room, the bathroom, hallways, etc. were immaculately clean. Our white marble bathroom wasn't huge, but nicer than any international bathroom we have ever had. We wanted a small, peaceful, intimate, Italian hotel experience; Daniels hotel was perfect for us.Via Frattina is a great location, lot's of shops, very safe,area for evening walks. We walked everywhere, to the Trevi Fountain, to the (very nearby)Spanish Steps and to the Pantheon. Dinner at La Rampa, behind the American Express Building was a nice suprise, reasonably priced too. My only suggestion for improvement would be to spice up the variety of food offered at the roof top breakfast bar upstairs. The coffee, fruit, pastries and ham were delicious however. Cecilia, York, PA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluestarz
Reviews.Content: Daniel's hotel is located near the Spanish steps, just around the corner from the famous Via Condotti, THE street of Italian fashion. We stayed there 9/3/2005 for 2 nights. It's a short ride by cab from the Train station* and a great central location. Daniel's is small, only 14 rooms, but is a 4 Star beauty. Via Frattina is a lovely, quiet, shopping street. Cars are mostly prohibited. So except for scooters, which are everywhere, Via Frattina predominantly has foot traffic. It is a short walk to the Spanish steps, and the Trevi fountain. It is a longer, yet do-able walk to the Colloseum. Our room, a junior suite, was beautifully furnished, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was large, with a Jacuzzi and Italian marble throughout. Breakfast is served on the rooftop,which is enclosed with windows. You can see the rooftops of Rome from here! Daniel's also has very good cappuccino...order one with your breakfast! *You can rent a car cheaper at the Train station than at the Airport. We didn't use a car in Rome, but rented it there and traveled around Italy for a week. I would only recommend this for the brave. Italians drive fast, a lot of the roads are curvy, and gas is over $5.00 a gallon. But it is the only way to really see the country, and we'll do it again!

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: magatoni
Reviews.Content: we found this place by accident as we were displeased with our other hotel choice......we were so glad to find daniel's hotel.....very nice and clean with a friendly staff and a fantastic room.....bathroom was big, marble and CLEAN!...you also can't beat the location....I would definitely stay here again...it was pricey at 270 euro but we were desperate......you will not go wrong staying here.......the elevator is tight but teh place is new and spiffy...........have a blast

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Daniel's for a week in September 2002. Our room was lovely and spacious with a GREAT bathroom. 5 star treatment in a small boutique hotel. There is a small roof terrace - not the best in town - but a nice place to sit and have a glass of wine. The staff was always courteous and helpful. The location of this hotel is excellent. Try Nino's restaurant one street over for one of the best meals you can have in Italy. We would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Daniel's Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Frattina 107, 00187 Rome, Italy
